description: In a way, Attorney General Mark Brnovich's campaign for the Senate is a test for Donald Trump.
story_text: Arizona's Senate race is really a test for Donald Trump . Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich on Thursday kicked off his campaign for the Senate with two strikes already against him. 1.     He has acknowledged that Joe Biden is president. 2.       He has been insufficiently enthusiastic about the election audit, declining to buy into the delusion that Donald Trump really won Arizona. Brnovich also has two things going for him that any Arizona Republican will need if they want to win a statewide election in 2022. 1.     He has acknowledged that Joe Biden is president. 2.       He has been insufficiently enthusiastic about the election audit, declining to buy into the delusion that Donald Trump really won Arizona. Brnovich is the best known of the Republican candidates and possibly the party’s best hope of recapturing a Senate seat in Arizona.  Solar power executive Jim Lamon and Michael “Mick” McGuire, the retired adjutant general of the Arizona National Guard, also have entered the race, with others still to come. Thus far, however, Brnovich has fundamentally failed the only test that seems to matter in Republican circles these days: Loyalty to Trump. Brnovich already risked the wrath of Trump in November when he became the first Republican officeholder in the state to dismiss the wild conspiracy theories about the many ways in which Trump was robbed. “If indeed there was some great conspiracy, it apparently didn't work …” he told Fox Business’ Neil Cavuto on Nov. 11, referring to the fact that Maricopa County Recorder Adrian Fontes, a Democrat, was knocked off by Republican Stephen Richer. “It came down to: People split their ticket,” Brnocich explained. “People voted for Republicans down ballot, and they didn’t vote for President Trump or Martha McSally. So, that's the reality.”. It’s just not a reality that Trump will tolerate or that the Trump Nation will accept. While Brnovich has defended the Senate’s legal right to conduct the election audit, he has not exactly hopped aboard the bamboo bandwagon. Trump has noticed. “He (Brnovich) is always on television promoting himself, but never mentions the Crime of the Century, that took place during the 2020 Presidential Election, which was Rigged and Stolen,” Trump said in late May. “Arizona was a big part and Brnovich must put himself in gear, or no Arizona Republican will vote for him in the upcoming elections. They will never forget, and neither will the great Patriots of our Nation!”. Here’s the problem for a guy like Brnovich and for  Republican candidates running for statewide office in general: . Failure to fawn over the ex-president can be fatal to your chances of winning a Republican primary.  But being spotted anywhere near the election audit that fully 55% of the state’s likely voters oppose?. That’s likely to be hazardous to your political health in November 2022. Brnovich has a desert full of land mines ahead of him but early indications are that he’s not going to follow in Martha McSally’s fated footsteps. His campaign video, released on Thursday, includes all the usual Republican touches, including a shot of the border and an allusion to election integrity. But he also threw up a screen shot from CNN’s election coverage, with the headline “Joe Biden elected president”. Brnovich gets it. If he wants to have a shot at beating Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly he cannot be beating a path to Trump's door. The question is, does Trump get it?. If the former president is smart, he’ll stay out of Arizona’s Senate race and give Brnovich the breathing room he needs to try to win conservative Republican votes without losing the moderate and independent voters he needs to win the seat. In the end, Arizona’s Senate race will be a test of sorts for Trump, the opportunity to show Arizona and the world what’s more important to the man who holds the Republican Party in the palm of his hand: . Recapturing his pride after 2020? Or recapturing the Senate in 2022?. Reach Roberts at laurie.roberts@arizonarepublic.com . Follow her on Twitter at @LaurieRoberts . . Support local journalism: Subscribe to azcentral.com today. . . .
title: Mark Brnovich's Senate run is really a test for Donald Trump
